definition: stele/vertical stone tablet for carved inscriptions
a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The stone is marked with the names of all our brave soldiers who laid down their lives in the war.
sentences.chinese: 這塊碑石上刻有在戰爭中犧牲的全部英勇戰士的名字。

sentences.english: Original temple steles hospital buildings, some forty to fifty pass monument.
sentences.chinese: 原來廟院內碑石林立，約有四五十通碑。

sentences.english: There were vines creeping across the blackened gravestones, slowly pulling them back to the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄藤纏繞變黑的碑石，慢慢將它們拖入熱帶叢林。

sentences.english: To resurrect cultural traditions, they brought some past steles here.
sentences.chinese: 爲了挽救文化，將碑石運到了這裏。

sentences.english: The original legislation in the river flood the monument has been Chongdao, has yet to repair.
sentences.chinese: 原來在河邊立的碑石已被洪水衝倒，至今還沒有修葺。

sentences.english: This was the first large-scale resurrection of steles in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 這就是中國歷史上第一次大規模收藏碑石的行動。

definition: a record of events inscribed on a tablet
the top part of a tablet
a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]
rock carving/cliff engraving/words carved into cliff face
inscribed stone tablet placed in the tomb/memorial inscription on such a tablet
